adjectives.description: apophatic (comparative more apophatic, superlative most apophatic)

entries.meaning: (theology) Pertaining to knowledge of God obtained through negation rather than positive assertions.
examples: For him, the assertions of Palamas ran counter to the apophatic insistence in Pseudo-Dionysius that God was unknowable in his essence.

entries.meaning: (by extension) That which passively defines a thing by describing what it is not characteristic thereof.
